messages.content: How many hours are necessary to play "Elden Ring" ?

The amount of time it takes to play Elden Ring depends on a number of factors, including your skill level, how much you explore, and whether you're trying to complete all of the optional content.

According to HowLongToBeat, the average player takes 80 hours to beat Elden Ring. However, some players have reported beating the game in as little as 30 hours, while others have spent over 100 hours exploring every nook and cranny.

If you're new to the Soulsborne genre, you may want to budget more time for your first playthrough. Elden Ring is a challenging game, and it's easy to get lost in the vast open world. However, if you're a seasoned Soulsborne veteran, you should be able to power through the game in a fraction of the time.

Ultimately, the amount of time it takes to beat Elden Ring is up to you. If you're looking for a challenge, you can spend hours exploring every corner of the map and trying to defeat every boss. Or, if you're just looking to experience the story, you can focus on the main objectives and beat the game in a fraction of the time.
So, for beginners, it needs more than 1000 hours to play Elden Ring ?

No, it does not take more than 1000 hours to play Elden Ring for beginners. The average player takes 80 hours to beat the game, but some players have reported beating it in as little as 30 hours, while others have spent over 100 hours exploring every nook and cranny. If you're new to the Soulsborne genre, you may want to budget more time for your first playthrough. Elden Ring is a challenging game, and it's easy to get lost in the vast open world. However, if you're a seasoned Soulsborne veteran, you should be able to power through the game in a fraction of the time.

Ultimately, the amount of time it takes to beat Elden Ring is up to you. If you're looking for a challenge, you can spend hours exploring every corner of the map and trying to defeat every boss.
